policy.title: Refusal To Harm Or Destroy Animals

regulation.title: Refusal To Harm Or Destroy Animals

issues.title: Missing High School Grade Level Coverage
issues.description: The regulation restricts the right to refrain from harming animals to only K-8 courses, but Education Code 32255.1 applies to all grade levels including high school (grades 9-12). The statute does not limit this right to elementary and middle school students only.

legal_citations.text: Pupils have the right to refrain from participating in educational projects involving the harmful or destructive use of animals... This section shall not apply to instruction in courses in agriculture, veterinary science, or other courses as determined by the governing board of the school district.

issues.required_language: Remove the limitation "This right shall apply to all K-8 courses" and replace with "This right shall apply to all courses" or specify that it applies to all grade levels K-12, maintaining only the statutory exceptions for agricultural education, veterinary science, and other courses as determined by the governing board.

issues.title: Incomplete Statutory Exceptions
issues.description: The regulation only mentions agricultural education as an exception, but Education Code 32255.1 also excludes veterinary science courses and allows the governing board to determine other course exceptions. The policy and regulation fail to acknowledge these additional statutory exceptions.

legal_citations.text: This section shall not apply to instruction in courses in agriculture, veterinary science, or other courses as determined by the governing board of the school district.

issues.required_language: Add language stating: "This right does not apply to instruction in courses in agriculture, veterinary science, or other courses as determined by the governing board of the school district."

issues.title: Missing Reference to Education Code 32255.3
issues.description: While the regulation mentions that teacher determinations shall not be arbitrary or capricious and cites Education Code 32255.3, the policy should also reference this protection to ensure board-level acknowledgment of this student right.

legal_citations.text: The teacher's determination of whether a pupil may pursue an alternative educational project shall not be arbitrary or capricious.

issues.required_language: Add reference to Education Code 32255.3 and language ensuring that any determination regarding alternative projects shall not be arbitrary or capricious.
